docs.snippet: The Democratic nominee in former House Speaker John Boehner's district has withdrawn from the November election, leaving a clear field for now for recently elected Republican U.S. Rep Warren Davidson to win a full term....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Democratic nominee in former House Speaker John Boehner's district has withdrawn from the November election, leaving a clear field for now for recently elected Republican U.S. Rep Warren Davidson to win a full term.

headline.main: Democrat Drops Out of US House Race for Boehner's Old Seat
headline.print_headline: Democrat Drops Out of US House Race for Boehner's Old Seat

docs.snippet: The U.N. Security Council called on the Central African Republic's new president on Tuesday to urgently foster reconciliation between Muslims and Christians in order to reunify the country which has been plagued by sectarian violence....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.N. Security Council called on the Central African Republic's new president on Tuesday to urgently foster reconciliation between Muslims and Christians in order to reunify the country which has been plagued by sectarian violence.

headline.main: UN Calls for Reconciliation in Central African Republic
headline.print_headline: UN Calls for Reconciliation in Central African Republic

docs.snippet: When Pope Francis arrives in Poland this week for World Youth Day, he will meet a nation still deeply committed to its conservative Catholic traditions and to the memory of St. John Paul II, who inspired this country's successful struggle against ...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Pope Francis arrives in Poland this week for World Youth Day, he will meet a nation still deeply committed to its conservative Catholic traditions and to the memory of St. John Paul II, who inspired this country's successful struggle against communism in the 1980s.

headline.main: Pope to Find a Catholic Poland Out of Step With His Vision
headline.print_headline: Pope to Find a Catholic Poland Out of Step With His Vision

docs.snippet: The Continent is struggling with how to respond to terrorism that does not fit neat definitions or lend itself to easy answers....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Continent is struggling with how to respond to terrorism that does not fit neat definitions or lend itself to easy answers.
docs.abstract: Surge in high-profile terrorist attacks on streets of Western Europe, along with sharp rise in public expressions of nationalism, are fueling political and social tensions and creating intense anxiety, with many expressing concerns their governments cannot keep them safe.

headline.main: String of Attacks in Europe Fuels a Summer of Anxiety
headline.print_headline: With No Singular Villain, Violence in Europe Fuels Summer of Anxiety

byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin contributed reporting from Paris.

docs.snippet: A revelatory trip off the beaten path in Corsica reveals a resilient and dramatically beautiful island that holds itself apart from mainland France....
docs.lead_paragraph: A revelatory trip off the beaten path in Corsica reveals a resilient and dramatically beautiful island that holds itself apart from mainland France.
docs.abstract: Island of Corsica, France, emerges as unlikely tourist destination; troubled history of colonization and subsequent attempts at freedom have failed to overshadow appeal of island's picturesque mountains and idyllic Mediterranean beaches.

headline.main: Into Corsica, From Rustic Villages to Stony Cliffs

docs.snippet: Supporters of Bernie Sanders, who lost to Hillary Clinton, booed when he urged them to vote for her despite revelations of bias by party leaders....
docs.lead_paragraph: Supporters of Bernie Sanders, who lost to Hillary Clinton, booed when he urged them to vote for her despite revelations of bias by party leaders.
docs.abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders struggles to unify delegates at Democratic National Convention following leak of emails that showed that party officials apparently schemed to help Hillary Clinton win presidential nomination; other speakers, including Elizabeth Warren and Michelle Obama, try to placate party's left wing in attempt to rally convention for Clinton.

headline.main: Democrats Struggle for Unity on First Day of Convention
headline.print_headline: Democrats Fight to Pull Together on an Unruly Day

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Rappeport, Yamiche Alcindor, Jason Horowitz and Colin Moynihan.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN
